result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven L Buckingham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,600.00 payable to Dicentron F., and $1,502.09 to Crime Victim Compensation Fund.  Surcharges applicab;e

Pay all Court costs, surcharges, DNA surcharge, each count.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid from 25% of funds under Sec.973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/ or tax intercept or other means.
Credit for 307 days. *10-09-2017 Amended as to counts one, two and three.

Provide DNA sample for the data bank; pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

09-01-2017/ Judge Thomas McAdams
The Court ordered that the defendant's motion to vacate the DNA surcharge on count one is denied, however, the DNA surcharges on counts two and three are vacated.  The defendant must seek reimbursement, if any from the DOC cashier's office in Madison.

received from Erin Welsh.
Defense counsel is in trial in another county and unable to appear.

Jury deliberations continued at 8:30 am in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Kathy Regan and Carl Hauski who were duly sworn for that purpose.  
  Jury panel in court.  At the hour of 10:00 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts of GUILTY as to all three counts which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court denied defense motion that this is a prima facie case.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.  Court ordered a PSI with no recommendation.

Sworn for the state as a rebuttal witness: Curtis Fleming.    
Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 4:46pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Kathy Regan and Leon Bond who were duly sworn for that purpose.

Sworn for the state:  MPD Officer Michael Wawrozyniakowski, MPD Detective Marco Salaam. Exhibits  53-56, 58-68, 72, 4 received. State rests.  Sworn for defense: MPD Detective James Campell, MPD Detective Walter Cappelli, MPD Detective Todd Fischer.  Defense rests.

Defendant Steven L Buckingham in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Steven L Buckingham in custody.  Denis Stingl for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Case calendared for SCHEDULING on 8/27/2014 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Steven L Buckingham in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Steven L Buckingham in custody. Karyn Behling for Marissa L. Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Steven L Buckingham in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Steven L Buckingham in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger for Marissa Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF1283 that are attached to the complaint.  The crimianl complaint is ordered orally amended.  The charging section in count 1 and 2 lists an address of 1706 North 40th Street, but should read 5110 West North Avenue.  Both are in the city and county of Milwaukee.    Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Detective Marco Salaam. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy. Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Arraignment scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.     No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dicentron F, Kira W, Antonia G, Tamar A or Alexandrea C.

Defendant Steven L Buckingham in court with student Intern Imran Kurter under the supervision ofattorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Steven L Buckingham in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense requests to address bail at next court date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
